channel.title: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]
channel.description: Okay I had my server up and running before, and I moved and had to completely redownload all my files and etc.. And completely re-set everything up.. Tell me what I'm overlooking or not seeing? Heres the vid.. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1owe2sECqDo

item.title: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]
item.dc:creator: @FuryofEdge FuryofEdge
item.description:
@FuryofEdge wrote:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rE6KbaR-grY[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 07, 2009, 05:15:33 pm[/size][hr]thanks for the reply. whatever im deleting all my files, im done with this shit. i wasted 3 months of my life fucking waking up at 6am, when going to bed at 4am, to fucking code and fix my server all fucking day. fuck this shit for good. recycle bin ftw.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]

item.title: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

server sided > server.java or one of the “Server” files server sided.
and client sided i believe its client.java ctrl+f search 43594, if not it’s in one of the non “class” files.

and you may have to open it through your firewall after.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]

item.title: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]
item.dc:creator: @FuryofEdge FuryofEdge
item.description:
@FuryofEdge wrote:

i wasnt running the restarter. where can i change the port on the client? and do i have to open port 5555? or is that like server sided or something?

Read full topic
item.source: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]

item.title: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

no-ip duc has nothing to do with that, try running just the “runserver.bat” Or “run.bat” or w.e it is, not the restarter, if it still says it’s port is in use, try and connect to the server, if it does not work, change your listening port on the server/client(unless its a port changing enabled client), to 5555 and try it.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]

item.title: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]
item.dc:creator: @FuryofEdge FuryofEdge
item.description:
@FuryofEdge wrote:

how am i supposed to know if something is running 43594? the main things i have open are like avast, and skype?.. do i need NO-ip DUC open all the time? i have 43594 open from firewall too. after i portforwarded online, i went on the firewall settings and opened em up there too…

Read full topic
item.source: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]

item.title: Getting my server to run [VID OF MY PROBLEM]
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

Something on your cp is running that port already, check to make sure programs like torrents (utorrent) are not running through port 43594, if it still doesn’t work, try switching ur listening port to 5555 (server/client sided) and if it works, then that means something on your cp is running that port already/a firewall/secuirty program is blocking that port.

Read full topic

That’s honestly not a lot.
